Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery little master cup; interior: glazed black; exterior, from top: part of reserved lip; glazed band; plastic hand in handle zone; glazed black below; possible accidental drips of glaze on hand, or attempt at uncertain decorative pattern.
Type series: Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the shape and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.765) (Phase 3)
